Thank you for providing more information. Based on your symptoms, it's possible that you may have a condition called psoriasis. Psoriasis is a chronic skin condition that can cause red, itchy, and scaly patches on the skin. The flat purple spots on your wrists and shins, as well as the white patches with a lacy design inside your mouth, are both common symptoms of psoriasis.

I would recommend that you schedule an appointment with a dermatologist for a proper diagnosis and treatment. They will be able to examine your skin and determine the best course of treatment for you. In the meantime, you can try over-the-counter topical creams or ointments that contain corticosteroids or vitamin D analogues to help reduce inflammation and itching.
